StandardNumber.description: The official identifier for this standard as published by BSI, CEN, or ISO, used for reference and citation in regulatory and contractual contexts

StandardTitle.description: The full official title of the standard, describing its scope and subject matter as it appears on the cover or title page

PublicationDate.description: The date on which this edition of the standard was officially published and made available by the issuing standards body

IssuingOrganization.description: The main organization responsible for the publication and maintenance of the standard, which may be a national or international standards body

TechnicalCommittee.description: The technical committee or working group responsible for the preparation and approval of the standard, providing subject matter expertise

ApprovalDate.description: The date on which the standard was formally approved by the relevant European or international committee

ISBN.description: The International Standard Book Number assigned to this publication for identification and cataloguing purposes

ICS.description: The International Classification for Standards code(s) assigned to this document, indicating its subject area within the global standards system

NationalImplementation.description: The status or method by which this European or international standard is adopted as a national standard in the United Kingdom or other countries

CopyrightHolder.description: The entity holding copyright for the standard, responsible for its distribution and licensing

CopyrightYear.description: The year in which copyright for this edition of the standard is held

CommitteeRepresentation.description: A description of the organizations or stakeholders represented on the technical committee responsible for the standard

NationalAnnexReference.description: Reference to any national annex or supplementary guidance provided to assist users in applying the standard within a specific country

AmendmentsOrCorrigenda.description: Information about any amendments or corrigenda issued since the original publication, including dates and affected text

ProjectInformationRequirements.description: Defines the appointing party's requirements for information to support decision-making at key project milestones during the delivery phase

InformationDeliveryMilestones.description: Scheduled events or dates for predefined information exchanges, aligned with the project's plan of work and decision points

InformationStandard.description: Specification of standards for structuring, classifying, and exchanging information within the project, including organizational and external requirements

InformationProductionMethodsAndProcedure.description: Documented methods and procedures for capturing, generating, reviewing, approving, securing, and distributing project information

ReferenceInformationAndSharedResources.description: Reference data and shared resources (such as templates, libraries, and existing asset information) provided to project teams to support information production and exchange

CommonDataEnvironment.description: The project's digital environment for managing, sharing, and controlling access to information containers, including unique identification, status, revision, and classification attributes

InformationProtocol.description: Project-specific protocol outlining obligations, intellectual property rights, licensing, and procedures for information management and use

ExchangeInformationRequirements.description: Detailed requirements for information exchanges to be met by the lead appointed party and appointed parties during the appointment

AcceptanceCriteria.description: Evidence or standards required to consider that information requirements have been fulfilled for project deliverables

BIMExecutionPlan.description: Plan explaining how the delivery team will manage information, including strategy, objectives, team structure, and proposed methods for BIM execution

ResponsibilityMatrix.description: Matrix identifying responsibilities for information production, exchange, and review among project participants and task teams

TaskInformationDeliveryPlans.description: Schedules maintained by each task team listing information containers, production durations, authors, and delivery milestones

MasterInformationDeliveryPlan.description: Aggregated plan combining all task information delivery plans, showing deliverables, dependencies, and review timelines for the delivery team

MobilizationPlan.description: Plan detailing the approach, timescales, and responsibilities for mobilizing resources, IT, and training to support information management

RiskRegister.description: Register of risks associated with timely information delivery and strategies for managing these risks throughout the project

ProjectCloseOutArchive.description: Process and requirements for archiving the completed project information model and containers in accordance with retention policies

LessonsLearned.description: Captured knowledge and insights from the project, recorded for use in future projects to improve information management practices

AppointingParty.description: Organization or individual responsible for initiating the project, defining information requirements, and appointing delivery teams

LeadAppointedParty.description: Party appointed by the appointing party to lead the delivery team and coordinate information management activities

AppointedParty.description: Party appointed by the lead appointed party to deliver specific tasks and produce required information

ProjectTeam.description: Collective group comprising the appointing party and all delivery teams involved in the project

TaskTeam.description: Subgroup within the delivery team responsible for producing and managing specific information deliverables

Project.description: A unique project identifier assigned at project initiation, distinct from any organization's internal job number, and fixed within the project information standard

Originator.description: A unique identifier for the organization responsible for producing the information within the container, assigned upon joining the project and fixed within the project information standard

VolumeSystem.description: A unique identifier for each volume or system, fixed within the project information standard; standard codes include 'ZZ' for all volumes/systems and 'XX' for none

LevelLocation.description: A unique identifier for each level or location, fixed within the project information standard; standard codes include 'ZZ', 'XX', '00', '01', 'M1', 'B1', etc.

Type.description: A unique identifier for the type of information held within the container, such as drawing, report, model, or specification, fixed within the project information standard

Role.description: A unique identifier for the role assigned to an organization on the project, such as architect, contractor, or engineer, fixed within the project information standard

Number.description: A sequential number assigned to each information container when it is one of a series, typically four to six digits with leading zeros as needed

Suitability.description: A code indicating the status or suitability of the information container, such as work in progress, shared, published, or as-constructed record, according to the codification table

Revision.description: A code indicating the revision of the information container, using preliminary (e.g., P01.01) or contractual (e.g., C01) formats as specified in the project information standard

Classification.description: A classification code for the information within the container, in accordance with Uniclass 2015 or ISO 12006-2:2018

Delimiter.description: The character used to separate fields in the information container ID, typically the hyphen-minus (Unicode U+002D)
